data.title: Vscode doesn't see git repo in nested folder
data.body: I've got a situation, where i open folder in vscode, which is not actually a root folder of a project, but an upper folder. It obviously contains nested folder with git repo, but I can't work with this repo in vscode, because it simply can't detect it

data.title: Errors shown in the message box are always also printed to the console

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
in the hello extension add this code:
```
vscode.workspace.openTextDocument('/foobar/info.txt').then(doc => vscode.window.showTextDocument(doc), err => vscode.window.showInformationMessage(err.message));
```
Make sure that '/foobar/info.txt' **does not** exist.
Run the extension and trigger the 'hello' action.

Observe annoying exception in dev tools:
![2017-08-08_14-18-38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29071583-8adbbd78-7c44-11e7-8029-c132a5227025.png)

Since the error is handled in a perfectly fine way, It is confusing for a developer that the dev tools open and show an exception stack trace.

data.title: Find and replace does not replace correctly when replacing many occurrences
data.body:
When trying to find & replace many occurrences at once, the value that is put in does not seem right.

E.g. if I try to replace 'Code.Abstractions' with 'MoreCode.Abstractions' at 500 occurrences in 100 files (or 4000 occurrences in 1200 files, does not matter), some occurrences (maybe 30-50) end up with 'CCode.Abstractions' or 'CodeAbstractions'. This seems to happen every time I try to mass replace a value.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
azure-functions-tools|joh|0.3.0
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a large .NET solution
2. Replace a namespace occurrence that is used a lot with something else (try to hit 1000+ occurrences)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

If you need any further information, please let me know!

data.title: Automated smoketest failed in "Debugging JavaScript autodetects program attribute for launch.json"
data.body:
After merging PR #32050 the automated smoke test failed with this error:

```
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5367300Z [0m  1) Smoke Test Suite Debugging JavaScript autodetects program attribute for launch.json:
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5394730Z [0m[31m     SyntaxError: Unexpected token } in JSON at position 385[0m[90m
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5419360Z       at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5439110Z       at JavaScriptDebug.<anonymous> (out/areas/javascript-debug.js:41:31)
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5454090Z       at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5467850Z       at fulfilled (out/areas/javascript-debug.js:8:58)
2017-08-07T07:19:07.5481780Z       at process._tickDomainCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:135:7)
```

Further investigation showed that commit #a9ebfd8814d71e4e92af776dcbf133535b3e81e4 contained the culprit in debugConfigurationManager.ts:

![2017-08-08_12-43-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29068563-9db3b7dc-7c37-11e7-9cc6-0973bd44d16b.png)

After the user selects a debug environment, the content of the launch.json is not passed as an IContent but just as a string. As a consequence the 'value' attribute is undefined and the indexOf doesn't exist.

data.title: When run in Terminal a programs unhandled exceptions don't produce debug dialog in win32
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
Run a C program with this code in the terminal:
`
void main(void)
{
   char *p = NULL;
   *p = 0;
}
`
and no dialog will appear. Run it outside of VSCode and it will.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Most of IDE's mouse cursor ( Not that insert cursor) is dark. When editor's background is dark, it is painful to find where is my mouse course ( although we use keybord in programing most of time).
this is what jetbrains' users said ( I am also a Pycharm user)  https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-68995   
VS code with dark theme ( such as OneDark-Pro) have this problem, too. And the pain is same. Hope you guys fix it  :)

data.title: HELP !! Cannot find runtime 'node' on PATH !
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
VS Code cannot find runtime 'node' on PATH. I've tried some ways to handle it, but failed.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:  v1.14.2 (x64)
- OS Version:  windows 7 (x64)

Environment variables checked contains:
B:\Users\Geolage\AppData\Roaming\npm;B:\Program Files\nodejs\;B:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe;B:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\bin
seems no problem there.

launch.json:
```js
{
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/js/app.js",
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        }
```

well, there's another problem that occurred before the prompt"cannot find...":
   alert 
   says " C:\Windows\System32\where.exe is not a valid Win32 application. "
and the debugger console below also logs that 
"Debugging with inspector protocol because Node.js v8.2.1 was detected." 
then nothing more

I also tried this: input "where node" insides integrated terminal, luckily it responsed:
"B:\Users\Geolage\Desktop\Projects\Web\Vottery>where node
B:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe"

So, in that situation, what should I do? 
@weinand

data.title: <keyboard button>+Click to `Open File` from Git Sidebar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature suggestion. Implement some keyboard button+Click combination on a file in Git Sidebar to `Open File` (not `Open Change`, which is being used by default by just clicking on a file). For example: Ctrl+Click (Command+Click), Option+Click (Alt+Click) or something like that.

Make a life a bit easier for a user when he tries to open files, which has been already edited by him, for further edition. :)

Broken JavaScript syntax highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:26:08.116Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-30-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
Nix|bbe|1.0.1
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-svgviewer|css|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
python|don|0.7.0
LogFileHighlighter|emi|1.1.1
vscode-nginx-conf-hint|han|0.0.4
docthis|joe|0.4.7
hg|mrc|1.1.5
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
vscode-nginx|sha|0.3.1
change-case|wma|1.0.0



---
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an empty `.js` file
2. Add code

```
describe("Test", function() {
    const options = {
        "condition": "<"
    };

    // Comment

    function initialize() { /* Empty */ }
});
```

3. Syntax is broken [(screenshot)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4l6ZVUiBYzbay1CUmRabXNvZTQ)
4. Delete `<` symbol
5. All good now [(screenshot)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4l6ZVUiBYzba21HVUt0RTcxTWM)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: angular4 autoimport problem
data.body:
I wrote code Angular4 with vscode. some module auto import is wrong.

for example, Routes, RouterModule auto import like this

```typescript
import { Routes, RouterModule } from "@angular/router/router";
```

but it's not correct. this is correct import statement
```typescript
import { Routes, RouterModule } from "@angular/router";
```

this problem have also 'angular/forms' modules import
```typescript
// wrong import
import { FormGroup } from "@angular/forms/forms";

// correct import 
import { FormGroup } from "@angular/forms";
```
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.5(16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. wrote Routes and click yellow lamb.
2. select import but there is no correct import statement
* this step has 3 recommend statements
```
 import { Routes } from "@angular/router/src";
 import { Routes } from "@angular/router/public_api";
 import { Routes } from "@angular/router/router";
```
3. I select third statement. but it occurred build error.
4. I changed statement correctly 
```typescript
import { Routes } from "@angular/router
```
5. next, RouterModule add auto import is done correctly like this
```typescript
import { Routes, RouterModule } from "@angular/router";
```


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Remove or support toggle off option for this multiple versions of same file rubbish
data.body:
Feature request.

This feature you have added (I'm not sure when, I've come back to using VSCode after several months off) where it is now possible to have two versions of the same file in the editor (one is the same name but all lower case) is the worst design decision I have ever encountered for a source code editor app. It is a disaster. It causes me constant doubt, confusion and frustration, even losing code changes on occasion. 

It will likely mean the end of me using VSCode. It's a game breaker for me.
Unless I can turn it off.

data.title: SimpleFindWidget Add next,previous,history: Fixes #29708 #29661
data.body:
@rebornix 
@Tyriar 
@mjbvz 
- Replaced PR #32074 

- Of course the last five percent was all the work
- The need for a new context for FindInput Focused was somewhat messy
- Had to touch more files than expected, was necessary as there are four clients
- Re-FactoringTheFindWidget for common use everywhere will take quite a bit of worksince it's so intertwined with the editor
- Hopefully this is useful until we re- factor TheWidget 
- Fixes #29708 #29661 also services the modified simpleFindWidget to all users
--

data.title: Improved "Go To Bracket" to jump to next bracket.
data.body: Worked with @rebornix to implement an improved version of "Go To Bracket" that behaves more like Vim. Now when "Go to Bracket" is run and select is not on a bracket, it will go to the next bracket. The current behavior of swapping between the open and close bracket remains the same.
